trans-unit.source: Provides control capability to display a calendar.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The calendar display is by day, week, or month.
Whether an entire month is rendered on a mobile device depends on the capabilities of the device.
In general, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control permits the selection of a date.
The mobile <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control wraps a Web Forms <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.

Although the mobile <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control mimics some properties, methods, and events of the underlying control, it does not expose other properties specific to HTML rendering.
To modify these, you can access the underlying control through the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.WebCalendar%2A> property and modify the settings directly.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Gets or sets the string used on CHTML and WML devices to enter the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar"></xref> control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
When this property is set to `null`, the default is the localized string (for example, "Calendar").
The string used on CHTML and WML devices to enter the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar"></xref>.
Returns an overridden <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar"></xref> object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is provided for the control developer to override the standard <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> class.
An overridden <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar"></xref>.
Gets or sets the day of the week to display in the first column of a calendar.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

In the ASP.NET API, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.FirstDayOfWeek%2A> enumeration contains every day of the week, with the default value returning the server's local setting for the first day of the week.
This property functions the same way as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.FirstDayOfWeek%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The day of the week displayed in the first column of a calendar.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FirstDayOfWeek.Default"></xref>.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.SelectionChanged"></xref> event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.SelectionChanged> event is raised when the user selects a day, a week, or an entire month by clicking the date selector controls.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.OnSelectionChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

When overriding the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.OnSelectionChanged%2A> method in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.OnSelectionChanged%2A> method so that registered delegates receive the event.
Raises events for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar"></xref> control when it posts back to the server.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is used primarily by custom control developers.
A `string` with data required for processing the event.
Called to raise an event indicating that the selection changed.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is called internally by ASP.NET.
It provides a wrapper to raise the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.SelectionChanged> event when a date is selected by the user.
Unlike the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.OnSelectionChanged%2A> method, this method is public and can be called by different adapters when they have collected the selected date.
Gets or sets the currently selected date.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Typically, you use this property together with the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.SelectionMode%2A> property to determine the selected date of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control.

To do this, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.SelectionMode%2A> property to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarSelectionMode.Day> - this setting allows only a single date selection from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control.
Browsing to the next or previous month will not update this property.
This property has the same functionality as the ASP.NET <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The currently selected date.
The default value is the value of <xref href="System.DateTime.MinValue"></xref>.
Gets a collection of selected dates from the ASP.NET <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property represents a collection of selected dates in a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control.
A collection of selected dates.
Occurs each time the user selects a day, a week, or a month in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar"></xref> control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Gets or sets the selection mode of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar"></xref> object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The Web Forms <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarSelectionMode> enumeration provides the selections described in the following table.
Value
Description
A single date can be selected on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control.
A single date or entire week can be selected on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control.
A single date, week, or entire month can be selected on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control.
No dates can be selected on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control.
**Note:** Avoid using this value, because some browsers still allow the user to select a date.
The selection mode of the calendar control.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarSelectionMode.Day"></xref>.
The specified value is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarSelectionMode"></xref> values.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether the control displays the names of the days of the week in the calendar header.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property has the same functionality as the Web Forms <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.ShowDayHeader%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
`true` if the names of the days of the week should be displayed in the calendar header; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets a date that specifies the month to display.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.VisibleDate%2A> property is updated after the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.VisibleMonthChanged?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised.
The date can be any day within the month.
Only the month value of the <xref:System.DateTime> object is used.
This property has the same functionality as the Web Forms <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.VisibleDate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The date that specifies the month to display.
The default is <xref href="System.DateTime.MinValue"></xref>.
Gets the underlying Web Forms <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The ASP.NET mobile controls do not duplicate the properties of the ASP.NET Web Forms <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control that are not supported on mobile devices.

Thus, if you want to use features that are available for the underlying <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control, you do so by accessing the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar?displayProperty=fullName> object through the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.WebCalendar%2A> property.
The underlying Web Forms <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler.RaisePostBackEvent(System.String)"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler> interface.
Arguments to be passed to the event handler.
